messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 963
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/1/01 12:31:25 PM, ChipandLaura@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/1/01 12:31:25 PM, ChipandLaura@... writes:

<< And Sandra, please don't word it that you are offened by what I said.. >>

THIS is personal.
Speaking in generalities about religions and political movements is not
personal.

Does the list exist for people to be welcomed, or to exchange information
among homeschoolers?

The political problem involved jumping on a family about raising dogs. My
pointing to the juxtaposition of that and the earlier pro-life arguments
(also about politics) was jumped on as being personal, which is was not.

Neither the presidential nor the dog overpopulation posts were mine.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 963
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/1/2001 11:31:25 AM Pacific Standard Time, ... Laura, The worst is over and there have been lots of new threads of discussion - please hang
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/1/2001 11:31:25 AM Pacific Standard Time,
ChipandLaura@... writes:


I stuck around a couple of days to see if it calmed down, and it seemed to
just a bit, then it picked back up again.  



Laura,

The worst is over and there have been lots of new threads of discussion -
please hang in there!

Dawn

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 963
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/1/01 1:28:42 AM Mountain Standard Time, ... I m sorry, I know the above sentence was made with good intentions, but it s extremely over
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/1/01 1:28:42 AM Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> am sorry to hear that Laura is unsubbing for reasons of not being properly
> welcomed on the list.


I'm sorry, I know the above sentence was made with good intentions, but it's
extremely over simplified.
I only pointed out that due to all the arguing and political and religious
bashing
going on, that those with unschooling questions and introductions are going
completely ignored.
I am not leaving because I was not welcomed..I'm now leaving because these
other issues all take precedence over things that we all have in common.
Rather than being thankful that we can all get along and share ideas, there
are those that seem to WANT to create arguments.
I can celebrate diversity too, but you do it with respect. NOT by arguing.

I stuck around a couple of days to see if it calmed down, and it seemed to
just a bit, then it picked back up again.

And Sandra, please don't word it that you are offened by what I said..
I still say you cannot speak for all Christians and that it concerns me that
other
non christians may base a judgement on a statement that may be true about YOUR
experiences, but certainly not mine. Although I have run across those types,
I
make a HUGE attempt to not across them again. <G>

Laura
